message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class pring{
    public static final String FILE_LOCATION = "C:/Users/DfroJaCk DB/Desktop/zongrecv.txt";
    public static void main ( String [ ] args )
    {
        //Your reader
        BufferedReader in = null;
        //Where you store the Strings
        ArrayList < String > al = new ArrayList < String > ();
        try
        {
            //Open the file and give it to the reader
            in = new BufferedReader ( new FileReader ( FILE_LOCATION ) );
            String line;
            //As long as the file has more lines read a line at a time
            while ( ( line = in.readLine () ) != null )
            {
                //Split the line and stoe it in an array
                String [ ] splitLine = line.split ( "SRC:" );
                for ( int i = 0; i < splitLine.length; i++ )
                {
                    //Add each element of the split array into an ArrayList
                    al.add ( splitLine [ i ] );
                }
            }
        //Catch your possible problems
        } catch ( FileNotFoundException fnfe )
        {
            fnfe.printStackTrace ();
        } catch ( IOException ioe )
        {
            ioe.printStackTrace ();
        }               //Sort your list
        Collections.sort ( al );
        
        // Tokenize the arraylist to display only the duplicate contact numbers and their content
        ArrayList<String> duplicateNumbers = new ArrayList<String>();
        ArrayList<String> duplicateContents = new ArrayList<String>();
        String previousNumber = "";
        for (String s : al) {
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(s, "|");
            String number = st.nextToken();
            String content = st.nextToken().substring(4);
            
            if (number.equals(previousNumber)) {
                duplicateNumbers.add(number);
                duplicateContents.add(content);
            }
            previousNumber = number;
        }
        
        // Print the duplicate contact numbers and their content
        for (int i = 0; i < duplicateNumbers.size(); i++) {
            System.out.println(duplicateNumbers.get(i) + " " + duplicateContents.get(i));
        }
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, after reading the file and storing the lines in an ArrayList, we can tokenize each line using StringTokenizer. We can extract the contact number by using the nextToken() method and the content after "ADD" by using the nextToken() method and then substringing it to remove the "ADD" part. We can then compare the contact numbers and store the duplicate numbers and their corresponding content in separate ArrayLists. Finally, we can print the duplicate contact numbers and their content.
